history.content:
If you did well on the HW and MT1, I wouldn't change it to P/NP - even if you're struggling with circuits, you have a bit of a cushion w.r.t grading at this point, and you should only really P/NP it if you're worried you'll fail (otherwise you'll have to take it again) 

--

I agree with the above answer. Also, EE16A is 2/3 linear algebra and 1/3 circuits so you should be fine.

If you did well on the HW and MT1, I wouldn't change it to P/NP - even if you're struggling with circuits, you have a bit of a cushion w.r.t grading at this point, and you should only really P/NP it if you're worried you'll fail (otherwise you'll have to take it again)

So I'm currently an undeclared L&S CS transfer, and I was wondering when it's worth it to take a class P/NP instead of for a grade. I'm taking EE16A which I have the option of doing P/NP, since I have already taken the equivalent of Math 54. I've done well up to this point, receiving full points on all the homework and doing very well on MT1. I'm just struggling a lot with circuits, and I'm worried about how I'll do on MT2 and the final. If I continue to put in consistent effort into this class, I feel like a decent grade in the end is possible, but I'm also worried about not doing as well as I'd hoped. I'm just hesitant to change my grading to P/NP because of how well I've been doing up until this point. Any advice?
history.subject: How to know if I should take this class P/NP?
